newsitem.title: USA: Safeguard to buy back 20 mln common shares. [CORRECTED 18:05 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Safeguard to buy back 20 mln common shares. [CORRECTED 18:05 GMT]

text.p: Safeguard Scientifics Inc said Tuesday its board has authorized the repurchase of up to $20 million of its common shares.
(Corrects to show repurchase is of up to $20 million of the company's shares not 20 million shares.)
The company, which holds large stakes in information technology companies, said the shares will be purchased in the open market at prevailing prices, subject to market conditions.

The company also disclosed that sales of its subsidiary, CompuCom Systems Inc, a computer seller, have been soft throughout the first quarter, "resulting in a need to adjust the outlook for its first quarter revenues."
It said soft sales have generally been experienced by companies in CompuCom's market as customers have been postponing decisions to buy.

"Compucom expects the market conditions for this shortfall to be resolved in the second quarter and to continue its history of annual growth," said Warren Musser, Safeguard's chairman and chief executive officer.
